content.description:
Climb the face just right of arete and left of Rapel Crack. Continue up left facing corner to ledge, then traverse left under flakes straight up to the tree. 

  Direct start is 5.10+.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Start on the far right of the crag in a left facing corner. Stem your way straight up.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Start on Ten Pins, then angle right and up over a small overhang.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description:
Not really a 5.14d, grade is unknown. 

  Route is on the left corner of the tower. Climbs through one bulging roof after another.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Start 4 feet left of Spider Man Direct. Difficult start, then up the face to a powerful move from a knee bar. Finish up past small beech tree on the face.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Start between Vision of Stem and Rappel Crack. Pull the bottom bulge, then stay right of the crack system and on the face to the top.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Start on a large flat boulder 4 feet left of the corner. Climb up through a bulge broken by a crack. Finish on the right.
content.protection: Ring anchors at the top of the pinnacle.

content.description: Start around the corner from the Spider starts. Climb up a rampy beginning until you reach the first horizontal crack. Traverse left and out around the corner until reaching a vertical crack. Finish on Spider Balls.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Start under the V block. Pull the overhang, then continue up the face to where the vertical and horizontal cracks join. Finish on Spider Balls.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Same start as Spider Balls, but traverse left while underclinging the first small overhang past the V block until you can get up to the horizontal crack. Traverse back right until over the V block and under the vertical crack, finishing on Spider Balls.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Start 3 feet left of the corner using two crimp side pulls to get up to the overhang. Pull this overhang to a horizontal crack. Traverse left on the horizontal until it meets a vertical crack, then continue straight to the top.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Same start as Spiderman Indirect, but instead of traversing left on the crack to Spiderballs line, continue straight up the face.  Follow the corner up to the bolts.  Nice mix of jugs at the bottom, little crimps in the middle and slopey pinchs past half-way.
content.protection: New bolts have been placed at the top of the tower for toproping.  Bolts are centered over the vertical crack so a fall means a big swing out to the left.

content.description: Start 3 feet left of the shallow corner of Yellow Pages. Pull the small overhand, then veer right on the face while staying between Yellow Pages and RC Direct.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Start three feet left of the corner. Climb the center of the face below the small ledge. Then, using solution holes, lunge for the right hand bucket and mantle to ledge.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Climb the obvious crack on right side of wall to the top.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Climb the corner and ramp left of Ten Pins.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Climb the right facing wall of Blazing Saddles corner without using the left facing wall.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: A deceptively easy start leads to a short crack, followed by an edge and some pockets loaded with sharp quartz crystals. Last move is a hard dyno over blank face to a good ledge and easy mantle.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Climb the arete or outside corner of Lost Religion and Crucifixion straight up.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Hipster is a crack system with a shallow roof just right of The Bitch. This route can be a dirty affair.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Starting just left of Grungie, climb the face straight up.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Climb the dirty offwidth and chimney that slopes up and right. Upper chimney has several large chockstones.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Start 5 feet left of Yellow Pages at some solution holes. Climb the face to corner.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: At the next left facing corner from Crucifixion, climb the inside corner up and through the overhang.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Start 17 feet left of Grungie. Climb the left facing ramp and right hand section of the face.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: Using the same start as The Bitch, climb the left handed side of the face.
content.protection: Build your own anchor at the top.

content.description: This is the main area containing the majority of the routes at Shaffer Rocks. This part of the cliff is at least 50 feet high, with some routes reaching ~70 feet on the left (west) end of the formation.
